text: In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
The LORD shall fight for you, and ye shall hold your peace.
Be strong and of a good courage; be not afraid, neither be thou dismayed: for the LORD thy God is with thee whithersoever thou goest.
The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
The LORD is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear?
God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
Thy word is a lamp unto my feet, and a light unto my path.
Trust in the LORD with all thine heart; and lean not unto thine own understanding.
The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runneth into it, and is safe.
But they that wait upon the LORD shall renew their strength; they shall mount up with wings as eagles.
Fear thou not; for I am with thee: be not dismayed; for I am thy God.
For I know the thoughts that I think toward you, saith the LORD, thoughts of peace, and not of evil.
Let your light so shine before men, that they may see your good works, and glorify your Father which is in heaven.
But seek ye first the kingdom of God, and his righteousness; and all these things shall be added unto you.
Come unto me, all ye that labour and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest.
Lo, I am with you alway, even unto the end of the world.
With men it is impossible, but not with God: for with God all things are possible.
And as ye would that men should do to you, do ye also to them likewise.
Fear not, little flock; for it is your Father's good pleasure to give you the kingdom.
For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son.
I am the light of the world: he that followeth me shall not walk in darkness.
I am the way, the truth, and the life: no man cometh unto the Father, but by me.
Peace I leave with you, my peace I give unto you.
Ye shall receive power, after that the Holy Ghost is come upon you.
There is therefore now no condemnation to them which are in Christ Jesus.
All things work together for good to them that love God.
Be not conformed to this world: but be ye transformed by the renewing of your mind.
And now abideth faith, hope, charity, these three; but the greatest of these is charity.
For we walk by faith, not by sight.
But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, longsuffering, gentleness, goodness, faith.
For by grace are ye saved through faith; and that not of yourselves: it is the gift of God.
Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.
Be careful for nothing; but in every thing by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known unto God.
I can do all things through Christ which strengtheneth me.
And whatsoever ye do, do it heartily, as to the Lord, and not unto men.
For God hath not given us the spirit of fear; but of power, and of love, and of a sound mind.
Now faith is the substance of things hoped for, the evidence of things not seen.
I will never leave thee, nor forsake thee.
If any of you lack wisdom, let him ask of God.
Every good gift and every perfect gift is from above.
Casting all your care upon him; for he careth for you.
If we confess our sins, he is faithful and just to forgive us our sins.
God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes.
Be strong and of a good courage, fear not, nor be afraid of them: for the LORD thy God, he it is that doth go with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee.
For the LORD seeth not as man seeth; for man looketh on the outward appearance, but the LORD looketh on the heart.
As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the LORD is tried: he is a buckler to all them that trust in him.
The joy of the LORD is your strength.
For I know that my redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth.
The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.
O taste and see that the LORD is good: blessed is the man that trusteth in him.
Create in me a clean heart, O God; and renew a right spirit within me.
He that dwelleth in the secret place of the most High shall abide under the shadow of the Almighty.
Enter into his gates with thanksgiving, and into his courts with praise: be thankful unto him, and bless his name.
Keep thy heart with all diligence; for out of it are the issues of life.
Commit thy works unto the LORD, and thy thoughts shall be established.
To every thing there is a season, and a time to every purpose under the heaven.
For unto us a child is born, unto us a son is given: and the government shall be upon his shoulder.
Thou wilt keep him in perfect peace, whose mind is stayed on thee: because he trusteth in thee.
But he was wounded for our transgressions, he was bruised for our iniquities.
So shall my word be that goeth forth out of my mouth: it shall not return unto me void.
It is of the LORD'S mercies that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not. They are new every morning: great is thy faithfulness.
A new heart also will I give you, and a new spirit will I put within you.
And they that be wise shall shine as the brightness of the firmament.
For I desired mercy, and not sacrifice; and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
And it shall come to pass afterward, that I will pour out my spirit upon all flesh.
But let judgment run down as waters, and righteousness as a mighty stream.
He hath shewed thee, O man, what is good; and what doth the LORD require of thee.
The just shall live by his faith.
The LORD thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy.
Not by might, nor by power, but by my spirit, saith the LORD of hosts.
Bring ye all the tithes into the storehouse... and prove me now herewith, saith the LORD of hosts.
Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.
Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind.
Go ye therefore, and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost.
Thou shalt love the Lord thy God with all thy heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy mind, and with all thy strength.
For with God nothing shall be impossible.
Ask, and it shall be given you; seek, and ye shall find; knock, and it shall be opened unto you.
In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
I am come that they might have life, and that they might have it more abundantly.
Greater love hath no man than this, that a man lay down his life for his friends.
And it shall come to pass, that whosoever shall call on the name of the Lord shall be saved.
Neither is there salvation in any other: for there is none other name under heaven given among men, whereby we must be saved.
But God commendeth his love toward us, in that, while we were yet sinners, Christ died for us.
That if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved.
God is faithful, who will not suffer you to be tempted above that ye are able.
My grace is sufficient for thee: for my strength is made perfect in weakness.
I am crucified with Christ: nevertheless I live; yet not I, but Christ liveth in me.
Now unto him that is able to do exceeding abundantly above all that we ask or think.
He which hath begun a good work in you will perform it until the day of Jesus Christ.
Let the peace of God rule in your hearts.
Rejoice evermore. Pray without ceasing. In every thing give thanks.
All scripture is given by inspiration of God, and is profitable for doctrine, for reproof, for correction, for instruction in righteousness.
For the word of God is quick, and powerful, and sharper than any twoedged sword.
Let us hold fast the profession of our faith without wavering; (for he is faithful that promised;)
Let us run with patience the race that is set before us.
Jesus Christ the same yesterday, and today, and for ever.
Submit yourselves therefore to God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you.
Draw nigh to God, and he will draw nigh to you.
Ye are a chosen generation, a royal priesthood, an holy nation, a peculiar people.
Above all things have fervent charity among yourselves: for charity shall cover the multitude of sins.
The Lord is not slack concerning his promise, as some men count slackness; but is longsuffering to us-ward.
Behold, what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called the sons of God.
Greater is he that is in you, than he that is in the world.
This is the confidence that we have in him, that, if we ask any thing according to his will, he heareth us.
Now unto him that is able to keep you from falling, and to present you faultless before the presence of his glory.
I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the ending, saith the Lord.
Behold, I stand at the door, and knock: if any man hear my voice, and open the door, I will come in to him.
They overcame him by the blood of the Lamb, and by the word of their testimony.
The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
Behold, I am with thee, and will keep thee in all places whither thou goest.
Honour thy father and thy mother: that thy days may be long upon the land.
Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.
The LORD bless thee, and keep thee: The LORD make his face shine upon thee, and be gracious unto thee.
Thou shalt love the LORD thy God with all thine heart, and with all thy soul, and with all thy might.
As for me and my house, we will serve the LORD.
Whither thou goest, I will go; and where thou lodgest, I will lodge.
There is none holy as the LORD: for there is none beside thee.
The LORD is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer.
There is no God like thee, in heaven above, or on earth beneath.
I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will heal thee.
O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good; for his mercy endureth for ever.
If my people, which are called by my name, shall humble themselves, and pray.
Ezra had prepared his heart to seek the law of the LORD, and to do it.
O Lord, I beseech thee, let now thine ear be attentive to the prayer of thy servant.
Who knoweth whether thou art come to the kingdom for such a time as this?
He knoweth the way that I take: when he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.
Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly.
Delight thyself also in the LORD: and he shall give thee the desires of thine heart.
Cast thy burden upon the LORD, and he shall sustain thee.
I will lift up mine eyes unto the hills, from whence cometh my help.
The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge.
Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.
Fear God, and keep his commandments: for this is the whole duty of man.
He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me was love.
Here am I; send me.
When thou passest through the waters, I will be with thee.
Call unto me, and I will answer thee, and shew thee great and mighty things.
The LORD is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.
I will cause the shower to come down in his season; there shall be showers of blessing.
Blessed be the name of God for ever and ever: for wisdom and might are his.
The ways of the LORD are right, and the just shall walk in them.
Turn ye even to me with all your heart, and with fasting, and with weeping, and with mourning.
It is he that buildeth his stories in the heaven, and hath founded his troop in the earth.
Therefore I will look unto the LORD; I will wait for the God of my salvation.
The LORD is good, a strong hold in the day of trouble; and he knoweth them that trust in him.
The LORD God is my strength, and he will make my feet like hinds' feet.
Seek ye the LORD, all ye meek of the earth.
Take my yoke upon you, and learn of me; for I am meek and lowly in heart: and ye shall find rest unto your souls.
With men this is impossible; but with God all things are possible.
If thou canst believe, all things are possible to him that believeth.
The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.
I am the resurrection, and the life: he that believeth in me, though he were dead, yet shall he live.
Believe on the Lord Jesus Christ, and thou shalt be saved, and thy house.
For the wages of sin is death; but the gift of God is eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord.
Rejoicing in hope; patient in tribulation; continuing instant in prayer.
Be ye stedfast, unmoveable, always abounding in the work of the Lord.
God loveth a cheerful giver.
Let us not be weary in well doing: for in due season we shall reap, if we faint not.
Be ye kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving one another, even as God for Christ's sake hath forgiven you.
Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.
Do all things without murmurings and disputings.
Set your affection on things above, not on things on the earth.
The Lord himself shall descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of the archangel, and with the trump of God.
Wherefore comfort yourselves together, and edify one another, even as also ye do.
The Lord is faithful, who shall stablish you, and keep you from evil.
Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life.
I have fought a good fight, I have finished my course, I have kept the faith.
For the grace of God that bringeth salvation hath appeared to all men.
For we have great joy and consolation in thy love.
For in that he himself hath suffered being tempted, he is able to succour them that are tempted.
Which hope we have as an anchor of the soul, both sure and stedfast.
He is able also to save them to the uttermost that come unto God by him.
Looking unto Jesus the author and finisher of our faith.
Even so faith, if it hath not works, is dead, being alone.
The effectual fervent prayer of a righteous man availeth much.
Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, which according to his abundant mercy hath begotten us again unto a lively hope.
Be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you.
According as his divine power hath given unto us all things that pertain unto life and godliness.
If any man sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous.
Beloved, let us love one another: for love is of God.
He that hath the Son hath life; and he that hath not the Son of God hath not life.
Be thou faithful unto death, and I will give thee a crown of life.
For the Lamb which is in the midst of the throne shall feed them, and shall lead them unto living fountains of waters.
Behold, the tabernacle of God is with men, and he will dwell with them.
There shall be no night there; and they need no candle, neither light of the sun; for the Lord God giveth them light.
Behold, I come quickly; and my reward is with me.
And whosoever will, let him take the water of life freely.
Ye thought evil against me; but God meant it unto good.
My presence shall go with thee, and I will give thee rest.
Weeping may endure for a night, but joy cometh in the morning.
As far as the east is from the west, so far hath he removed our transgressions from us.
The liberal soul shall be made fat: and he that watereth shall be watered also himself.
The LORD shall guide thee continually, and satisfy thy soul in drought.
Ah Lord GOD! behold, thou hast made the heaven and the earth by thy great power.
Our God whom we serve is able to deliver us from the burning fiery furnace.
I cried by reason of mine affliction unto the LORD, and he heard me.
Out of thee shall he come forth unto me that is to be ruler in Israel.
In the beginning God created the heaven and the earth.
For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son.
